MtkL1B2Reproject.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*===========================================================================
00002 =                                                                           =
00003 =                               MtkL1B2Reproject                            =
00004 =                                                                           =
00005 =============================================================================
00006 
00007                          Jet Propulsion Laboratory
00008                                    MISR
00009                                MISR Toolkit
00010 
00011             Copyright 2005, California Institute of Technology.
00012                            ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.
00013                  U.S. Government Sponsorship acknowledged.
00014 
00015 ============================================================================*/
00016 
00017 #include "MisrToolkit.h"
00018 #include "MisrError.h"
00019 #include <stdio.h>      /* for printf */
00020 #include <getopt.h>     /* for getopt_long */
00021 #include <strings.h>        /* for strncasecmp */
00022 #include <HdfEosDef.h>      /* Definition of GDopen */
00023 
00024 #define MAX_FILENAME 5000
00025 #define MAX_FIELDNAME 1000
00026 #define MAX_LENGTH 1000
00027 #define NUMBER_BAND 4
00028 #define NUMBER_CAMERA 9
00029 #define OUTPUT_GRIDNAME "L1B2Reproject"
00030 
00031 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00032 /* Structure to contain command-line arguments.                             */
00033 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00034 
00035 typedef struct {
00036   char *proj_map_file;  /* Projection/map info file */
00037   char *terrain_file;   /* GRP_TERRAIN file*/
00038   char *output_basename;   /* Output basename*/
00039   int  band;            /* Band to process. -1 = all */
00040 } argr_type;       /* Argument parse result */
00041 
00042 #define ARGR_TYPE_INIT {NULL, NULL, NULL, -1}
00043 
00044 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00045 /* Local function prototypes                                                */
00046 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00047 
00048 int process_args(int argc, char *argv[], argr_type *argr);
00049 
00050 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00051 /*  Main program.                                                           */
00052 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00053 
00054 int main( int argc, char *argv[] ) {
00055   MTKt_status status;       /* Return status */
00056   MTKt_status status_code = MTK_FAILURE;  /* Return code of this function */
00057   argr_type argr = ARGR_TYPE_INIT;  /* Command-line arguments */
00058   char *band_name[NUMBER_BAND] = {"Blue","Green","Red","NIR"};
00059   char *camera_name[NUMBER_CAMERA] = {"Df","Cf","Bf","Af","An",
00060                       "Aa","Ba","Ca","Da"};
00061   MTKt_GenericMapInfo target_map_info = MTKT_GENERICMAPINFO_INIT;
00062                 /* Target map information. */
00063   MTKt_GCTPProjInfo target_proj_info = MTKT_GCTPPROJINFO_INIT;
00064                 /* Target projection information.  */
00065   MTKt_Region region = MTKT_REGION_INIT; /* SOM region containing target map. */
00066   MTKt_DataBuffer toa_brf_data = MTKT_DATABUFFER_INIT; 
00067                 /* Top-of-atmosphere BRF data */
00068   MTKt_MapInfo    toa_rad_rdqi_map_info = MTKT_MAPINFO_INIT;
00069                 /* Map information for terrain RDQI.  */
00070   MTKt_DataBuffer toa_rad_rdqi = MTKT_DATABUFFER_INIT; 
00071                 /* Top-of-atmosphere radiance data quality indicator */ 
00072   MTKt_DataBuffer toa_brf_mask = MTKT_DATABUFFER_INIT; 
00073                 /* Valid mask for TOA BRF. */
00074   MTKt_MapInfo    toa_brf_map_info = MTKT_MAPINFO_INIT;
00075                 /* Map information for terrain-projected radiance.  */
00076   MTKt_DataBuffer latitude = MTKT_DATABUFFER_INIT; 
00077                 /* Temporary latitude array for reprojection. */
00078   MTKt_DataBuffer longitude = MTKT_DATABUFFER_INIT; 
00079                 /* Temporary longitude array for reprojection. */
00080   MTKt_DataBuffer line_coords = MTKT_DATABUFFER_INIT; 
00081                 /* Temporary line coord array for reprojection. */
00082   MTKt_DataBuffer sample_coords = MTKT_DATABUFFER_INIT; 
00083                 /* Temporary sample coord array for reprojection. */
00084   MTKt_DataBuffer resampled_toa_brf_data = MTKT_DATABUFFER_INIT; 
00085                 /* Input TOA BRF, resampled to target map. */
00086   MTKt_DataBuffer resampled_toa_brf_mask = MTKT_DATABUFFER_INIT; 
00087                 /* Valid mask for final result. */
00088   int path;             /* Orbit path number. */
00089   int camera;           /* Camera index. */
00090   int iband;            /* Loop iterator. */
00091   int iline;            /* Loop iterator. */
00092   int isample;          /* Loop iterator. */
00093   char outputfile[MAX_FILENAME];
00094   int32 fid = FAIL;     /* HDF-EOS file identifier. */
00095   int32 gid = FAIL;     /* HDF-EOS grid identifier. */
00096   int32 hstatus;        /* HDF-EOS status code */
00097   float64 upleft[2];            /* min X, max Y corner of target map. */
00098   float64 lowright[2];          /* max X, min Y corner of target map. */
00099   char *dimlist_ul_lr = "YDim,XDim";
00100                 /* HDF-EOS dimension list for origin UL or 
00101                    origin LR maps.*/
00102   char *dimlist_ur_ll = "XDim,YDim";
00103                 /* HDF-EOS dimension list for origin UR or 
00104                    origin LL maps.*/
00105   char *dimlist;        /* HDF-EOS dimension list. */
00106   int32 edge[2];        /* Size of HDF-EOS data to write. */
00107   char fieldname[MAX_FIELDNAME]; /* Fieldname to read/write. */
00108   char gridname[MAX_FIELDNAME];  /* Gridname to read. */
00109   int size_x;            /* Size of map along X axis. */
00110   int size_y;            /* Size of map along Y axis. */
00111   int32 tile_rank = 2;       /* HDF tile rank */
00112   int32 tile_dims[2] = {64,64};  /* Tile dimensions. */
00113   int32 comp_code = HDFE_COMP_DEFLATE; /* GZIP compression code. */
00114   int32 comp_parm[1] = {5};        /* GZIP compression level. */
00115   float32 fill_float32 = -9999.0;      /* Fill value for float32 fields. */
00116 
00117   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00118   /* Parse command-line arguments.                                      */
00119   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00120 
00121   if (process_args(argc, argv, &argr))
00122     MTK_ERR_CODE_JUMP(MTK_BAD_ARGUMENT);
00123 
00124   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00125   /* Read projection / map information for target area.                 */
00126   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00127 
00128   status = MtkGCTPProjInfoRead(argr.proj_map_file, &target_proj_info);
00129   if (status != MTK_SUCCESS) {
00130     printf("\n\nCheck that projection/map info filename is correct: %s\n",argr.proj_map_file);
00131     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with MtkGCTPProjInfoRead\n");
00132   }
00133 
00134   status = MtkGenericMapInfoRead(argr.proj_map_file, &target_map_info);
00135   if (status != MTK_SUCCESS) {
00136     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with MtkGenericMapInfoRead\n");
00137   }
00138 
00139   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00140   /* Get orbit path number of input file.                               */
00141   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00142 
00143   status = MtkFileToPath(argr.terrain_file, &path);
00144   if (status != MTK_SUCCESS) {
00145       printf("\n\nCheck that input filename is correct: %s\n",argr.terrain_file);
00146       MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with MtkFileToPath(input)\n");
00147   }
00148 
00149   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00150   /* Get camera identifier from terrain input file.                     */
00151   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00152 
00153   {
00154     MTKt_DataBuffer attrbuf = MTKT_DATABUFFER_INIT;
00155 
00156     status = MtkFileAttrGet(argr.terrain_file,"Camera",&attrbuf);
00157     if (status != MTK_SUCCESS) {
00158       printf("\n\nCheck that GRP_TERRAIN filename is correct: %s\n",argr.terrain_file);
00159       MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with MtkFileAttrGet(terrain_file)\n");
00160     }
00161     
00162     camera = attrbuf.data.i32[0][0] - 1;
00163   }
00164 
00165   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00166   /* Setup SOM region containing the target map.                        */
00167   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00168 
00169   status = MtkSetRegionByGenericMapInfo(&target_map_info,
00170                     &target_proj_info,
00171                     path,
00172                     &region);
00173   if (status != MTK_SUCCESS) {
00174     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with MtkSetRegionByGenericMapInfo\n");
00175   }
00176 
00177   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00178   /* Create HDF-EOS file for result.                                    */
00179   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00180 
00181   if (target_map_info.origin_code == MTKe_ORIGIN_UL ||
00182       target_map_info.origin_code == MTKe_ORIGIN_LR) {
00183     dimlist = dimlist_ul_lr;
00184   } else {
00185     dimlist = dimlist_ur_ll;
00186   }
00187   
00188   edge[0] = target_map_info.size_line;
00189   edge[1] = target_map_info.size_sample;
00190 
00191   upleft[0] = target_map_info.min_x;
00192   upleft[1] = target_map_info.max_y;
00193   lowright[0] = target_map_info.max_x;
00194   lowright[1] = target_map_info.min_y;
00195 
00196   size_x = (int)floor((target_map_info.max_x - target_map_info.min_x) / 
00197               target_map_info.resolution_x + 0.5);
00198   size_y = (int)floor((target_map_info.max_y - target_map_info.min_y) / 
00199               target_map_info.resolution_y + 0.5);
00200     
00201   snprintf(outputfile,MAX_FILENAME,"%s_%s.hdf",argr.output_basename,
00202        camera_name[camera]);
00203   
00204   fid = GDopen(outputfile,DFACC_CREATE);
00205   if (fid == FAIL) {
00206     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with GDopen\n");
00207   }
00208     
00209   hstatus = GDcreate(fid,OUTPUT_GRIDNAME,size_x, size_y, 
00210              upleft, lowright);
00211   
00212   gid = GDattach(fid, OUTPUT_GRIDNAME);
00213   if (gid == FAIL) {
00214     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with GDattach\n");
00215   }
00216   
00217   hstatus = GDdeforigin(gid,target_map_info.origin_code);
00218   if (hstatus == FAIL) {
00219     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with GDdeforigin\n");
00220   }
00221   
00222   hstatus = GDdefpixreg(gid,target_map_info.pix_reg_code);
00223   if (hstatus == FAIL) {
00224     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with GDdefpixreg\n");
00225   }
00226 
00227   hstatus = GDdefproj(gid,target_proj_info.proj_code,
00228               target_proj_info.zone_code, target_proj_info.sphere_code,
00229               target_proj_info.proj_param);
00230   if (hstatus == FAIL) {
00231     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with GDdefproj\n");
00232   }
00233 
00234   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00235   /* Calculate pixel lat/lon locations for target map.                  */
00236   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00237 
00238   status = MtkGCTPCreateLatLon(&target_map_info,
00239                    &target_proj_info,
00240                    &latitude,
00241                    &longitude);
00242   if (status != MTK_SUCCESS) {
00243     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with MtkGCTPCreateLatLon\n");
00244   }
00245 
00246   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00247   /* For each band to process...                                        */
00248   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00249 
00250   for (iband = 0 ; iband < NUMBER_BAND ; iband++)  {
00251     if (argr.band < 0 || iband == argr.band) {
00252 
00253       printf("Processing band %d (%s)...\n",iband, band_name[iband]);
00254 
00255   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00256   /* Read TOA BRF for the target area.                                  */
00257   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00258 
00259       snprintf(gridname,MAX_FIELDNAME,"%sBand",band_name[iband]);
00260       snprintf(fieldname,MAX_FIELDNAME,"%s BRF",band_name[iband]);
00261       
00262       status = MtkReadData(argr.terrain_file, gridname, fieldname,
00263                region, &toa_brf_data, &toa_brf_map_info);
00264       if (status != MTK_SUCCESS) {
00265     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with MtkReadData(Terrain)\n");
00266       }
00267 
00268   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00269   /* Read terrain-projected radiance data quality indicators for the    */
00270   /* the target area.                                                   */
00271   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00272 
00273       snprintf(gridname,MAX_FIELDNAME,"%sBand",band_name[iband]);
00274       snprintf(fieldname,MAX_FIELDNAME,"%s RDQI",band_name[iband]);
00275       
00276       status = MtkReadData(argr.terrain_file, gridname, fieldname,
00277                region, &toa_rad_rdqi, &toa_rad_rdqi_map_info);
00278       if (status != MTK_SUCCESS) {
00279     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with MtkReadData(Terrain)\n");
00280       }
00281 
00282   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00283   /* Generate mask indicating valid TOA BRF.                            */
00284   /* TOA BRF is considered valid where the terrain-projected radiance   */
00285   /* data quality is less than 2.                                       */
00286   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00287 
00288       status = MtkDataBufferAllocate(toa_brf_data.nline, toa_brf_data.nsample,
00289                      MTKe_uint8,&toa_brf_mask);
00290       if (status != MTK_SUCCESS) {
00291     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with MtkDataBufferAllocate(toa_brf_mask)\n");
00292       }
00293 
00294       for (iline = 0; iline < toa_brf_data.nline; iline++) {
00295     for (isample = 0; isample < toa_brf_data.nsample; isample++) {
00296       if (toa_rad_rdqi.data.u8[iline][isample] < 2) {
00297         toa_brf_mask.data.u8[iline][isample] = 1;
00298       } else {
00299         toa_brf_mask.data.u8[iline][isample] = 0;
00300       }
00301     }
00302       }
00303 
00304   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00305   /* Free memory.                                                       */
00306   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00307       
00308       MtkDataBufferFree(&toa_rad_rdqi);
00309 
00310   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00311   /* Reproject TOA BRF to target map.                                   */
00312   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00313 
00314       status = MtkTransformCoordinates(toa_brf_map_info, 
00315                        latitude, 
00316                        longitude,
00317                        &line_coords,
00318                        &sample_coords);
00319       if (status != MTK_SUCCESS) {
00320     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with MtkTransformCoordinates\n");
00321       }
00322 
00323       status = MtkResampleCubicConvolution(&toa_brf_data, 
00324                        &toa_brf_mask, 
00325                        &line_coords, 
00326                        &sample_coords, 
00327                        -0.5,
00328                        &resampled_toa_brf_data,
00329                        &resampled_toa_brf_mask);
00330       if (status != MTK_SUCCESS) {
00331     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with MtkResampleCubicConvolution\n");
00332       }
00333 
00334   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00335   /* Free memory                                                        */
00336   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00337       
00338       MtkDataBufferFree(&resampled_toa_brf_mask);
00339       MtkDataBufferFree(&toa_brf_mask);
00340       MtkDataBufferFree(&toa_brf_data);
00341 
00342   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00343   /* Free memory                                                        */
00344   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00345 
00346       MtkDataBufferFree(&line_coords);
00347       MtkDataBufferFree(&sample_coords);
00348 
00349   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00350   /* Write input TOA BRF to HDF-EOS file.                               */
00351   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00352 
00353       snprintf(fieldname,MAX_FIELDNAME,"TOA_BRF_%s_%s",
00354            camera_name[camera], band_name[iband]);
00355 
00356       hstatus = GDdeffield(gid, fieldname, dimlist, DFNT_FLOAT32, 0);
00357       if (hstatus == FAIL) {
00358     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with GDdeffield\n");
00359       }
00360 
00361       hstatus = GDsetfillvalue(gid, fieldname, &fill_float32);
00362       if (hstatus == FAIL) {
00363     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with GDsetfillvalue()\n");
00364       }
00365       
00366       hstatus = GDsettilecomp(gid, fieldname, tile_rank, 
00367                   tile_dims, comp_code, comp_parm);
00368       if (hstatus == FAIL) {
00369     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with GDsettilecomp()\n");
00370       }
00371 
00372       hstatus = GDwritefield(gid, fieldname, NULL, NULL, edge, 
00373                  resampled_toa_brf_data.dataptr);
00374       if (hstatus == FAIL) {
00375     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with GDwritefield\n");
00376       }
00377 
00378   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00379   /* Free memory.                                                       */
00380   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00381 
00382       MtkDataBufferFree(&resampled_toa_brf_data);
00383 
00384   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00385   /* End loop for each band to process.                                 */
00386   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00387 
00388     }
00389   }
00390 
00391   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00392   /* Free memory.                                                       */
00393   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00394   
00395   MtkDataBufferFree(&latitude);
00396   MtkDataBufferFree(&longitude);
00397 
00398   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00399   /* Close HDF-EOS file.                                                */
00400   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00401 
00402   hstatus = GDdetach(gid);
00403   if (hstatus == FAIL) {
00404     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with GDdetach\n");
00405   }
00406   gid = FAIL;
00407   
00408   hstatus = GDclose(fid);
00409   if (hstatus == FAIL) {
00410     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with GDclose\n");
00411   }
00412   fid = FAIL;
00413 
00414   printf("Wrote output to %s\n",outputfile);
00415   printf("Completed normally.\n");
00416   return 0;
00417 
00418 ERROR_HANDLE:
00419   if (gid != FAIL) {
00420     hstatus = GDdetach(gid);
00421   }
00422   if (fid != FAIL) {
00423     hstatus = GDclose(fid);
00424   }
00425   
00426   MtkDataBufferFree(&resampled_toa_brf_mask);
00427   MtkDataBufferFree(&resampled_toa_brf_data);
00428   MtkDataBufferFree(&latitude);
00429   MtkDataBufferFree(&longitude);
00430   MtkDataBufferFree(&toa_brf_mask);
00431   MtkDataBufferFree(&toa_rad_rdqi);
00432   MtkDataBufferFree(&toa_brf_data);
00433   MtkDataBufferFree(&line_coords);
00434   MtkDataBufferFree(&sample_coords);
00435 
00436   printf("Failed: status code = %d\n",status_code);
00437   
00438   return status_code;
00439 }
00440 
00441 void usage(char *func) {
00442   fprintf(stderr,
00443 "\nUsage: %s [--help] [--band=<band number>] \n"
00444 "                     <projection/map info file> <GRP_TERRAIN file>\n"
00445 "                     <output basename>\n",
00446       func);
00447 
00448   fprintf(stderr,
00449 "\n"
00450 "Perform reproject L1B2 terrain data to given map projection.\n"
00451 "\n"
00452 "Result is written to an HDF-EOS file in the following fields:\n"
00453 "    TOA_BRF_<cam>_<band>             Input TOA BRF from GRP_TERRAIN file (reprojected).\n"
00454 "\n"
00455 "All output fields have identical map projection and size.\n"
00456 "\n"
00457       );
00458 
00459   fprintf(stderr,
00460 "COMMAND-LINE OPTIONS\n"
00461 "\n"
00462 "--help\n"
00463 "     Returns this usage info.\n"
00464 "\n"
00465 "--band=<band number>\n"
00466 "     Specifies the band to process.  Bands are identified by integer values as\n"
00467 "     follows: 0 = blue   1 = green   2 = red   3 = nir\n"
00468 "\n"
00469       );
00470 
00471   fprintf(stderr,
00472 "COMMAND-LINE ARGUMENTS\n"
00473 "\n"
00474 "<projection/map info file>\n"
00475 "    Text file specifying map projection for the output.  Parameters are\n"
00476 "    specified as name = value pairs.   Parameter names are as follows:\n"
00477 "\n"
00478 "       proj_code is the GCTP projection code.\n"
00479 "       utm_zone is the UTM zone number for UTM projections only.\n"
00480 "       sphere_code is GCTP spheroid code.\n"
00481 "       proj_param(n) is the nth GCTP projection parameter.  (1 <= n <= 15)\n"
00482 "       min_corner_x is the minimum X coordinate at the edge of the map.\n"
00483 "       min_corner_y is the minimum Y coordinate at the edge of the map.\n"
00484 "       resolution_x is the size of a pixel along the X-axis.\n"
00485 "       resolution_y is the size of a pixel along the Y-axis.\n"
00486 "       number_pixel_x is the size of the map in pixels, along the X-axis.\n"
00487 "       number_pixel_y is the size of the map in pixels, along the Y-axis.\n"
00488 "       origin_code defines the corner of the map at which pixel 0,0 is located.\n"
00489 "       pix_reg_code defines whether a pixel value is related to the corner or\n"
00490 "         center of the corresponding area of that pixel on the map.  If the\n"
00491 "         corner is used, then it is always the corner corresponding to the\n"
00492 "         corner of the origin.\n"
00493 "\n"
00494 "       Possible values for origin_code are:\n"
00495 "         UL - Upper Left (min X, max Y);  Line=Y, Sample=X\n"
00496 "         UR - Upper Right (max X, max Y); Line=X, Sample=Y\n"
00497 "         LL - Lower Left (min X, min Y);  Line=X, Sample=Y\n"
00498 "         LR - Lower Right (max X, min Y); Line=Y, Sample=X\n"
00499 "\n"
00500 "       Possible values for pix_reg_code are:\n"
00501 "         CENTER - Center\n"
00502 "         CORNER - Corner\n"
00503 "\n"
00504 "       Unrecognized parameter names are ignored.\n"
00505 "       Lines starting with a '#' character are ignored.\n"
00506 "       Anything after the name = value pair on a line is ignored.\n"
00507 "\n"
00508 "       Example projection/map info file:\n"
00509 "       # Albers equal-area conic projection parameters\n"
00510 "       proj_code = 3    # Albers equal-area conic\n"
00511 "       sphere_code = 8  # GRS80\n"
00512 "       proj_param(3) = 29030000.0  # Latitude of the first standard parallel\n"
00513 "       proj_param(4) = 45030000.0  # Latitude of the second standard parallel\n"
00514 "       proj_param(5) = -96000000.0 # Longitude of the central meridian\n"
00515 "       proj_param(6) = 23000000.0  # Latitude of the projection origin\n"
00516 "       # Map information\n"
00517 "       min_corner_x = 1930612.449614\n"
00518 "       min_corner_y = 2493633.488881\n"
00519 "       resolution_x = 250.0\n"
00520 "       resolution_y = 250.0\n"
00521 "       number_pixel_x = 1311\n"
00522 "       number_pixel_y = 2078\n"
00523 "       origin_code = UL\n"
00524 "       pix_reg_code = CENTER\n"
00525 "\n"
00526 "\n"
00527 "<GRP_TERRAIN>\n"
00528 "    MISR Terrain-projected Radiance Product (GRP_TERRAIN).\n"
00529 "\n"
00530 "<output basename>\n"
00531 "    Basename for output file.\n"
00532 "\n"
00533 "Examples:\n"
00534 "\n"
00535 "     MtkL1B2Reproject --band=2 proj_map_info.txt \\\n"
00536 "         MISR_AM1_GRP_TERRAIN_GM_P011_O013824_DF_F03_0024.b52-56.hdf \\\n"
00537 "         BRF_O013824_maine\n"
00538 "\n"
00539 "     MtkL1B2Reproject \\\n"
00540 "         proj_map_info.txt \\\n"
00541 "         MISR_AM1_GRP_TERRAIN_GM_P011_O013824_DF_F03_0024.b52-56.hdf \\\n"
00542 "         BRF_O013824_maine\n"
00543 "\n"
00544       );
00545 }
00546 
00547 int process_args(int argc, char *argv[], argr_type *argr) {
00548 
00549   MTKt_status status_code = MTK_FAILURE;
00550   extern char *optarg;
00551   extern int optind;
00552   int ch;
00553   argr->band = -1;
00554   
00555   /* options descriptor */
00556   static struct option longopts[] = {
00557     { "band", required_argument, 0, 'b' },
00558     { "help", no_argument,       0, 'h' },
00559     { 0,      0,                 0,  0 }
00560   };
00561 
00562   while ((ch = getopt_long(argc, argv, "b:h", longopts, NULL)) != -1) {
00563 
00564     switch(ch) {
00565     case 'h':
00566       MTK_ERR_CODE_JUMP(MTK_FAILURE);
00567       break;
00568     case 'b' : 
00569       argr->band = (int)atol(optarg);
00570       break;
00571     default:
00572       MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Invalid arguments");
00573     }
00574   }
00575 
00576   if (argc-optind != 3) MTK_ERR_CODE_JUMP(MTK_OUTBOUNDS);
00577 
00578   argr->proj_map_file = argv[optind++];
00579   argr->terrain_file = argv[optind++];
00580   argr->output_basename = argv[optind++];
00581 
00582   return MTK_SUCCESS;
00583  ERROR_HANDLE:
00584   usage(argv[0]);
00585   return status_code;
00586 }
